results.title: Placebo-controlled comparison of captopril, atenolol, labetalol, and pindolol in hypertension complicated by intermittent claudication.
results.text_hl: In a six month placebo-controlled cross-over trial twenty @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral arterial disease@@@ were randomised to @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@ 25 mg twice daily, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 100 mg once daily, @CHEMICAL_Labetalol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007741 @@@labetalol@@@ 200 mg twice daily, or @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@ 10 mg twice daily for one month.

citations.NLM: Roberts DH, Tsao Y, McLoughlin GA, Breckenridge A. Placebo-controlled comparison of captopril, atenolol, labetalol, and pindolol in hypertension complicated by intermittent claudication. Lancet. 1987 Sep 19;2(8560):650-3. PMID: 2887941

results.title: The effect of beta-blockade on leg blood flow in hypertensive patients with intermittent claudication.
results.text_hl: The present study was designed to assess the short-term effects of beta-blocking antihypertensive treatment on leg blood flow in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral artery disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Boström PA, Janzon L, Ohlsson O, Westergren A. The effect of beta-blockade on leg blood flow in hypertensive patients with intermittent claudication. Angiology. 1986 Mar;37(3 Pt 1):149-53. PMID: 3706817
